explain: The core idea of Aspect 1 is that Sir Bradley Wiggins, a four-time Olympic champion, will attempt the cycling's hour record on June 7, 2015 at London's Olympic Velodrome. Wiggins' attempt to break the current record is being highly anticipated by cycling enthusiasts around the world. The hour record is a grueling test of endurance, requiring cyclists to ride as far as possible in a single hour, and Wiggins' participation in this event is expected to generate excitement and media coverage for the sport of cycling.

To provide an overview or an understanding of a key concept or principle.

In the given context, the aspect states that Bradley Wiggins is a four-time Olympic champion and a 2012 Tour de France winner. This information highlights Wiggins' impressive achievements in his cycling career. As an Olympic champion, Wiggins has demonstrated exceptional skill and endurance in multiple cycling events at the Olympic Games, further cementing his position as one of the best cyclists of his generation. Additionally, Wiggins' victory at the 2012 Tour de France signifies his prowess in one of the most prestigious and challenging cycling events, solidifying his position as a true legend in the world of cycling.

The current hour record is an achievement in cycling that measures the farthest distance a cyclist can travel in one hour on a velodrome track. Rohan Dennis holds the current record with 52.491 kilometers, which was set in 2015. Breaking this record will require incredible endurance, strength, and tactical planning. The hour record has long been a symbol of a cyclist's prowess and is a highly respected accomplishment in the cycling world.

To encourage and inspire people to take up cycling and challenge themselves in both fitness and personal development.

Summary:
Bradley Wiggins, a four-time Olympic champion cyclist, will attempt to break the cycling's hour record in June at the London's Olympic Velodrome. He ended his career with Team Sky in the Paris-Roubaix on Sunday.

Aspect:
Wiggins wants to motivate people to challenge themselves and ride their bikes, inspiring them to pursue cycling as a way to improve fitness and personal development.

Wiggins' attempt at breaking the Hour Record will take place at the London's Olympic Velodrome in front of a full-house crowd and be broadcast live on Sky Sports, making it a highly anticipated and significant event for both cycling enthusiasts and casual fans alike.

The aspect highlights the fact that the event will attract a large and enthusiastic audience, many of whom will be die-hard fans of Bradley Wiggins, a four-time Olympic champion. The sell-out crowd coupled with live broadcast on Sky Sports will make the event more exciting and accessible, creating a sense of occasion and anticipation for the millions watching around the world. This will not only generate interest in the event but also in cycling as a whole, potentially inspiring new fans to take up the sport or attend future races.

Both the summary and aspect highlight that Bradley Wiggins, a four-time Olympic champion, is aiming to break the hour record at the London's Olympic Velodrome in June. Additionally, the aspect mentions Wiggins targeting a British record eighth Olympic medal along with breaking the hour record. It implies that Wiggins is not only aiming to achieve a historic feat in the cycling world but also to add to his already impressive collection of Olympic medals. Wiggins has a prestigious career in cycling, and this new challenge aligns with his ambition to continually push boundaries and set new records.

In relation to the summary, the aspect highlights that Sir Bradley Wiggins, a four-time Olympic Champion, will race in the Tour de Yorkshire before attempting to break the cycling's hour record in June at London's Olympic Velodrome. The Tour de Yorkshire is a three-day cycling race, and Wiggins' participation in it demonstrates his preparation and dedication to his hour record attempt. Riding in the Paris-Roubaix before the hour record attempt also indicates Wiggins' desire to gain endurance and test his fitness ahead of this high-profile event.

What is the goal of Wiggins' hour record attempt?

Bradley Wiggins, a four-time Olympic champion cyclist, is planning to attempt breaking the hour record in cycling at the London Velodrome in June. His main aim with this challenge is not just to set a new record but to inspire people to challenge themselves and ride more frequently. Wiggins hopes that by achieving an impressive mark in the hour record, he will motivate people around the world to take up cycling and set personal goals for themselves in the sport. His attempt will not only celebrate cycling as a competitive sport but also promote it as a healthy and enjoyable activity for people of all ages and backgrounds.
